data.title: Death toll in French territory of Mayotte from Cyclone Chido is ‘several hundred,’
data.description: The death toll in the French territory of Mayotte from Cyclone Chido is “several hundred” and may run into the thousands, the island’s top government official told a local broadcaster Sunday.

data.title: 6,600 GHB debtors register for debt restructuring in first 2 days
data.description: The ‘You Fight, We Help’ scheme aims to help 1.9 million borrowers nationwide in a bid to lower household debts

data.title: Farmers queue at govt banks on first day of rice payments
data.description: Subsidy scheme transferring up to 10,000 baht per household to 4.3 million farmers this week, under govt budget of 37 billion

data.title: Will Thailand dethrone Singapore as global investment hub in 2025?
data.description: Experts say Thailand’s adoption of Global Minimum Tax could lure multinational HQs away from Singapore

data.title: Thailand and Mongolia aim to boost trade to $100 million by 2027
data.description: Commerce Minister Pichai Naripthaphan eyes rapidly growing market for Thai food, vehicles and investment

data.title: Gen Z: World drivers shaping workplace in 2025
data.description: Although Gen Zs have faced criticism for their work abilities, this year will see them revolutionise workplace norms as they step into young managerial roles.

data.title: 10 technologies to watch in 2025
data.description: Organisations, businesses, and the public must adapt to technological changes that will reshape industries and society in the year to come

data.title: Ten workplace trends set to transform the business world in 2025
data.description: Leading team management consultants encourage flexibility in working from home and prioritising mental health

data.title: Rollout of universal health coverage to continue in 2024
data.description: The initial push covered four provinces, with the remaining 31 provinces to be online by the end of 2024

data.title: Patty Tavatanakit and Jake Knapp Win 2nd Grant Thornton Invitational
data.description: After an impressive putting display throughout the week at Tiburón Golf Club, Paphangkorn "Patty" Tavatanakit from Thailand and American Jake Knapp claimed the Grant Thornton Invitational title in their tournament debut on Sunday in Naples, Florida.

data.title: Schools targeted with AI learning apps despite experts' doubts
data.description: Apps infused with AI are being marketed to schools across the world and governments are rushing to embrace the technology, despite experts raising serious doubts.

data.title: South braces for more flooding, North remains cool and windy
data.description: More misery is in store for Southern Thailand today, as downpours add to the already  severe flooding in Nakhon Si Thammarat

data.title: 'e-ga,' a Thai restaurant on Sukhumvit 23
data.description: If you are someone who often reminisces about the delicious tastes of food from various places in your memories, we recommend stopping by 'e-ga,' a Thai restaurant on Sukhumvit 23, that brings the flavors of Thai home cooking to the heart of Bangkok.

data.title: Not just tariffs: Trump 2.0 could bring some trade deals for Southeast Asia too
data.description: The tariffs may sting, but Southeast Asia can still strike some sweet deals with the growth-focused Trump administration.

data.title: Myanmar energy investments exceed $26.5 billion by November 2024
data.description: Myanmar’s energy sector had attracted more than US$26.5 billion in foreign investment as of the end of November 2024, accounting for 28.43 % of the total foreign investment, according to figures released by the Department of Investment and Companies Administration (DICA).

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: SAC Chair urges end to conflicts in 50th Rakhine State Day message
data.description: Senior General Min Aung Hlaing, Chairman of the State Administration Council (SAC), urged the MNDAA TNLA and AA, to end armed conflicts in the 50th Rakhine State Day message.

data.title: Myanmar energy investments exceed $26.5 billion by November 2024
data.description: Myanmar’s energy sector had attracted more than US$26.5 billion in foreign investment as of the end of November 2024, accounting for 28.43 % of the total foreign investment, according to figures released by the Department of Investment and Companies Administration (DICA).

data.title: RBSO stages Christmas concert
data.description: The Main Hall of Thailand Cultural Centre on Ratchadaphisek Road will be filled with festive tunes during "Sound Of The Seasons" this Saturday from 7.30pm.

data.title: AI for the elderly
data.description: Healthcare workers at government hospitals face an overwhelming workload every morning due to the large number of patients. Currently, robots known as Dinsaw Intelligent OPDs assist staff in screening patients at three hospitals -- Chulalongkorn, Siriraj and Phramongkutklao.

data.title: Artistic, with insects
data.description: When Thanapat Termsintawee was a third-year student at the School of Fine and Applied Arts, Bangkok University, he conducted a thesis which compared human society to ant colonies. Working on the thesis led him to keep ants and develop a familiarity with the insects.

data.title: Thailand wins silver in global hospitality competition
data.description: Team Thailand claimed second place at the prestigious "World Young Chef Young Waiter Young Mixologist (YYY) Competition 2024", recently held in Singapore.

data.title: 'Demon Chef' Leung fires up Dusit Thani
data.description: The Pavilion restaurant at the newly-reimagined flagship hotel Dusit Thani Bangkok is hosting "The Maverick Academy Live Showcase Dinner", tomorrow at 7pm.

data.title: Thai PM arrives in Malaysia for official two-day visit
data.description: SEPANG: Thailand’s Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra arrived in Malaysia on Sunday (Dec 15) to begin a two-day official visit at the invitation of Prime Minister Datuk Seri Anwar Ibrahim.

data.title: Second edition of ‘workation’ project launched
data.description: The second edition of a project featuring pop-up working spaces in five destinations across Thailand was launched on Sunday in a bid to campaign “workations” in the country.

data.title: Five Chinese men allegedly found working as labourers in Bangkok
data.description: Police raid follows tips that foreigners might be working illegally at demolition site
